page.title: 16BEAUSALE (CONTINUED)
page.content: {LION FARM, BEAUSALE. A MIXED FARM WITH SOME MILKING COWS.SILAGE FOR WINTER FEED AND CATTLE CAKE MADE BY THE FARMER. SOME OF THE FARM BUILDINGS ARE OVER 200YRS OLD. {HILL FARM. LIKE LION FARM SOME OF THE BUILDINGS ARE OVER 200YRS OLD. SOME OF THE NEW BARNS HAVE BEEN BUILT WITH TELEGRAPH POLES. THE POLES COST Â£5.00 EACH. THIS FARM IS A PIG FARM WITH ABOUT 15 PIGS.PIGS ARE BRED ON THE FARM AND THEN SOLD TO SNELSONS OR OTHER LOCAL FIRMS FOR MEAT. {EARTHWORK THERE IS AN ANCIENT CAMP AT BEAUSALE BUT ACCESS TO IT IS DIFFICULT. {BARRACKS LANE SO CALLED BECAUSE AN OLD SOLDIER LIVED IN THE LANE. HIS HOME WAS NICKNAMED THE BARRACKS SO THE LANE BECAME KNOWN AS BARRACKS LANE.
